Package com.xm.cryptorecservice.persistence

Interface DatabaseConnection

All Known Implementing Classes:
DatabaseConnectionImpl
public interface DatabaseConnection
An interface for communicating with a relational database.
See Also:
  • DatabaseConnectionImpl

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    createCryptoPriceTable(@NonNull String tableName)
    Create a table with the provided name and three columns: id (auto-generated, pkey), timestamp and price.
    void
    createTableOfCryptoNames(@NonNull List<String> cryptoNames)
    Create a table called CRYPTOS with two columns: id (auto-generated, pkey) and name.
    Optional<CryptoPrice>
    getCryptoPriceById(@NonNull String cryptoName, @NonNull Long id)
    Attempt to retrieve a specific CryptoPrice entry by its unique ID.

    Get the < timestamp, price > tuples for the provided crypto and corresponding date.

    Attempt to retrieve the minimum, maximum, first and last crypto price for the provided crypto.

  • Method Details

    • createCryptoPriceTable

      void createCryptoPriceTable(@NonNull @NonNull String tableName)
      Create a table with the provided name and three columns: id (auto-generated, pkey), timestamp and price.
      Parameters:
      tableName - The name of the table to create.

    • createTableOfCryptoNames

      void createTableOfCryptoNames(@NonNull @NonNull List<String> cryptoNames)
      Create a table called CRYPTOS with two columns: id (auto-generated, pkey) and name.
      Parameters:
      cryptoNames - The list of names to add to the table.

    • insertAllCryptoPrices

      void insertAllCryptoPrices(@NonNull @NonNull String tableName, @NonNull @NonNull List<CryptoPrice> cryptoPrices)
      Insert all provided crypto prices into the table specified by tableName. Implementations are free to do this in batch mode or not.
      Parameters:
      tableName - The name of the table to insert prices to.
      cryptoPrices - A List of CryptoPrice instances, every one of which needs to be persisted as a row in the table.

    • getCryptoPriceById

      Optional<CryptoPrice> getCryptoPriceById(@NonNull @NonNull String cryptoName, @NonNull @NonNull Long id)
      Attempt to retrieve a specific CryptoPrice entry by its unique ID.
      Parameters:
      cryptoName - The name of the crypto (and table) whose ID we are querying.
      id - The unique ID of the < price, timestamp > we want to return.
      Returns:
      An Optional which will contain an instance of CryptoPrice if the database lookup returned a row, or Optional.empty() otherwise.

    • getCryptoPriceStats

      Optional<CryptoPriceStats> getCryptoPriceStats(@NonNull @NonNull String cryptoName)
      Attempt to retrieve the minimum, maximum, first and last crypto price for the provided crypto.
      Parameters:
      cryptoName - The name of the crypto (and corresponding table).
      Returns:
      An Optional which will contain an instance of CryptoPriceStats with the aforementioned stats if the database lookup was able to retrieve them, or Optional.empty() otherwise.

    • getCryptoPricesForDate

      List<CryptoPrice> getCryptoPricesForDate(String cryptoName, String date)
      Get the < timestamp, price > tuples for the provided crypto and corresponding date.
      Parameters:
      cryptoName - The crypto to search the prices of.
      date - The date (in YYYY-mm-dd format) to search the prices for.
      Returns:
      A List with all the prices we were able to find for the particular date (could be empty if there were no prices or some other error occurred during the lookup).
